column5: During a moose bow hunt this weekend, I saw a huge bull elk come right under my tree stand, I dident get any time for a photo!  Did you here that the mnr are thinking of a experimental ontario elk hunt next fall?
elk or caribou>?
Bull elk, my friend got a shot of the the same bull from his stand 40yards away.Ill try to post it!
Here you go!
That is a gorgeous animal... Where was this???
We spotted this about 100km west of Thunder bay.
Do you think this is one of those animals from that Alberta heard or was it a "native" - did the MNR release in that area?
very cool.  how far is that away from where they released elk years back?

I know its likely impossible but there was what looked a LOT like an elk taken down by wolves on my parents property SE of north bay.   Had wrapped its leg up in a fence and taken down...not sure if the wolves found it wrapped up or if it was backing up into the fence to get away from them.  I looked at what was left and could swear it was a young elk - but then, that's impossible......right?
Very cool...and a great photo by your buddy.  Cheers  Craig  PS...how did the moose hunt go...???
one of those sassy buggers has been spotted down here in ktown over the last week.they arfe taking over i think since released in bancroft and rainy river. get some
Yes, Bancroft it was.  Some information:  http://www.bancroftontario.ca/elk/   Beautiful animal. Thanks for sharing
Thats a great picture..
Thanks, Im thinking it may be one of the lake of the woods elk, im not totaly sure on it.ps..the hunt went good!
What a majestic animal!  ummmm, how tall a tree is your bud's stand in?
There are several living in a bush 1/2 mile north of Madoc on my buddys farm, he says they do a lot of damage to his fences.
He had a ground blind,he said the elk was looking at me while I yelled holy crap! He stayed feeding for about 5mins.
they're obviously not wise to the ways of hunters yet since there's no open season!  two years off...  i wonder what they tast like>\?

Cool pic He probably is from the bunch released near Cameron Lake south of Kenora about ten or so years back they are pretty spread out now. there is a few hanging around just north of town here. Buddy found a shed this spring of a nice bull.
Nice picture.  Are you sure this was taken from a tree stand? Looks like a crouching ground postion to me.
Wow... cool pic.
I for one cant wait till theres a season on them, what a blast.
Thanks,the MNR said they are thinking about a chance for a 2010 elk season!
